title: BaseBall Data
text: bbd package lightweight package contains functions facilitate collection baseball data various sources online. package currently experimental. function interfaces liable change without notice. mature feature rich baseball data package, consider baseballr.

title: BaseBall Data
text: can install development version bbd GitHub :

title: BaseBall Data
text: basic usage bbd collecting statcast data games played two dates, inclusive.
code: library(bbd) ws_2022 = statcast(start = "2022-10-28", end = "2022-11-05") data.frame(names = names(ws_2022), types = sapply(ws_2022, typeof)) #>                              names     types #> 1                       pitch_type character #> 2                        game_date   integer #> 3                    release_speed    double #> 4                    release_pos_x    double #> 5         events character #> 10                     description character #> 11                        spin_dir   logical #> 12            spin_rate_deprecated   logical #> 13          break_angle_deprecated   logical #> 14         break_length_deprecated   logical #> 15                            zone   integer #> 16                             des character #> 17 #> 34                           on_1b   integer #> 35                    outs_when_up   integer #> 36                          inning   integer #> 37                   inning_topbot character #> 38           fielder_2   integer #> 43                          umpire   logical #> 44                           sv_id character #> 45                             vx0    double #> 46                             vy0    double #> 47                             vz0    double #> 48                              ax    double #> 49                              ay    double #> 50 what: Download all Statcast data within a range of dates — statcast
title: Download all Statcast data within a range of dates — statcast
text: Download Statcast data within range dates

title: Download all Statcast data within a range of dates — statcast
code: statcast(   start = Sys.Date() - 1,   end = NULL,   batter = NULL,   pitcher = NULL,   process = FALSE,   names = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Download all Statcast data within a range of dates — statcast
text: start Start date search. end End data search. Defaults NULL, stops search atstart date. batter Statcast player ID batter interest. Defaults NULL. pitcher Statcast player ID pitcher interest. Defaults NULL. process Controls processing data. Defaults FALSE. TRUE, data processed using statcast_min_process function. names Controls processing names. Defaults FALSE. TRUE, names processed using statcast_names function. verbose Controls messaging user. Defaults FALSE provides message. TRUE, informs user date begins downloading.

title: Download all Statcast data within a range of dates — statcast
text: object class c("tbl_df", "tbl", "data.frame") containing Statcast events start date end date inclusive.

what: Download all Statcast data for a particular date — statcast_day
title: Download all Statcast data for a particular date — statcast_day
Download all Statcast data for a particular date — statcast_day
code: statcast_day(   date = Sys.Date() - 1,   batter = NULL,   pitcher = NULL,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Download all Statcast data for a particular date — statcast_day
text: date date batter Statcast player ID batter interest. Defaults NULL. pitcher Statcast player ID pitcher interest. Defaults NULL. verbose Controls messaging user. Defaults FALSE provides message. TRUE, informs user date begins downloading.

title: Download all Statcast data for a particular date — statcast_day
